Bases: object

ADD = 0¶
LEAVE = 2¶
REMOVE = 1¶
assign_stuff_to_issue(issue)¶

Mom’s spaghetti Figures out which users are already assigned, which are to be assigned and calls correct functions depending on the strategy configured

Parameters

issue – an issue json as retrieved from github

Returns

nothing

change_config(reposlug, strategy=None, dry_run=None)¶

Sets multiple things at once, otherwise it’s a boring setter

Parameters

  • reposlug – A string containing f”{repo_owner}/{repo_name}”

  • strategy – What strategy is to be used options: “append”, “set”, “change”

  • dry_run – boolean saying whether changes are to be persisted or not

does_any_pattern_match(pattern_list, string)¶

Checks if the string supplied matches at least one of the patterns in pattern list

Parameters

  • pattern_list – list of regexp patterns

  • string – a string for the regexps to be matched against

Returns

boolean if match was found or not

get_fallback_label()¶

Gets the fallback label from the configuration rule file if there is such a thing. Otherwise returns None

Returns

string containing the label or None

get_user_patterns()¶

Prepares the data from the rule config

Returns

Dict[str “username”, Dict[str “pattern name”, list[re “regexp”]]]

for example: {“LittleshyFIM”: {“title”: [“derpy”, “is”], “text”: [“the”], “label”: [“best”], “any”: [“pony”]}}

namedrop_assignee(action, username)¶

Writes a symbol indicating what action will be done and the username provided

Parameters

  • action – one of self.ADD self.REMOVE self.LEAVE

  • username – the str username

Returns

nothing

solve()¶

Gets stuff done. Call after you are happy with the configuration of the solver

Returns

well thanks pycharm for generating this useless field. This method does not return anything useful

update_users(action, user_list, issue_number)¶

Makes the calls to update assignees

Parameters

  • action – specifies what will be done with users in the user list. One of self.ADD REMOVE LEAVE

  • user_list – list of strings - usernames, to be affected

  • issue_number – an issue number to be affected

Returns

write_fallback(message: str)¶

Writes a fallback message with a four space indentation

Parameters

message – a fallback message string to write

ghia.ghia_cmd.validate_file(ctx, param: click.core.Option, path: str)¶

Attempts to load the file provided with configparser

Parameters

  • ctx – mandatory for click validators, not used otherwise

  • param – mandatory for click validators, not used otherwise

  • path – actually it’s a file obtained open(path, “r”) or something along those lines.

Returns

configparser object

ghia.ghia_cmd.validate_reposlug(ctx, param, slug: str)¶

A click validator that check if the reposlug is in owner/reponame format

Parameters

  • ctx – mandatory for click validators, not used otherwise

  • param – mandatory for click validators, not used otherwise

  • slug – the actual string obtained from the user

Returns

a tuple (owner, reponame)

ghia.ghia_web module¶

ghia.ghia_web.create_app(some_argument)¶

Initializes the flask app with configfiles set in env variable GHIA_CONFIG - the paths to config files separated by “:” There are two files expected. rules and auth config file

Parameters

some_argument – idk, but has to be there

Returns

the flask app object

ghia.ghia_web.load_config(path: str)¶

An alternative for loading configuration files without click

Parameters

path – a path to a configparser parsable file

Returns

a configparser object

ghia.ghia_web.react_to_hook(app, json_data)¶

Configures the solver according to github provided json_data and the app config, then calls the solver to analyze and modify the assignees on the specified issue

Parameters

  • app – The flask app object

  • json_data – The json data as received from the HTTP POST from github

Returns

nothing

get_issue_list()¶

Collects json of all open issues into a list

Returns

List of json issues

get_next_page_link_from_request(request)¶

Handles inconveniences when getting a link to the next page in a function, so it doesn’t stink everywhere needs the header to be in a special format expected to be returned from github when asked nicely

Parameters

request – a request that is actually a response, oops, not changing that now, also it is expected to contain a link to the next page in its header

Returns

The link if there is one, otherwise None is returned

get_user_info()¶

Asks github about info on the user authenticated ba the api key

Returns

json received after asking github about the logged-in user

set_issue_labels(issue, issue_labels: List[str])¶

Politely asks github to add labels in a list

Parameters

  • issue – the issue json that should be labeled

  • issue_labels – Which labels should be put on it

update_assignee(action: int, username: str, issue_number)¶

Tells github to add or remove an assignee on an issue

Parameters

  • action – a number, 0 means ADD, 1 means REMOVE, getting the enumeration into a separate file for use in here is harder than writing this

  • username – username to assign or delete

  • issue_number – number of the issue that is in need of changing

write_error(message: str, indentation=0)¶

Writes an indented error because that was the requirement. Guys, the app just failed, but the error is indented so no need to panic… Am i bored? No, why would i be bored?

Parameters

  • message – le message to be printed

  • indentation – a number of spaces that will be added in front
